intro: Piper sotae, commonly known as the Sotá plant, is a member of the Piperaceae family, which includes various species of flowering plants. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and heart-shaped leaves with a glossy surface. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in spikes and are followed by small, three-lobed berries. Piper sotae is often used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
